2023-07-09T15:56:54Z: We have a short break before the next race, the Hungarian GP, which takes place on 21-23 July. Until then have a lovely few days and go well, cheers!
2023-07-09T15:55:09Z: With all that fun over for another year it is time to call time on this live coverage of the British GP. Some fantastic racing at Silverstone and a popular podium.
2023-07-09T15:50:21Z: There's a jump start with getting busy with the fizzy on the podium - to the stewards room with all of you!
2023-07-09T15:47:09Z: The fans have flooded on to the track for the podium ceremony. No British national anthem this year, but two home heroes either side of the winner - something for everyone.
2023-07-09T15:43:21Z:
Here's the British GP race report: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-british-gp-race-report/10493893/
    
Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB19, Lando Norris, McLaren MCL60
Photo by: Andy Hone / Motorsport Images
2023-07-09T15:32:59Z: Albon takes a terrific eighth place for Williams ahead of both Ferraris who round out the points places.
2023-07-09T15:32:30Z: Piastri was very unlucky with the timing of the safety car and finishes fourth, which is still the best result of his rookie season. Russell takes fifth ahead of Perez and Alonso.
2023-07-09T15:30:46Z: That's Verstappen's sixth straight win and Red Bull's 11th win in a row. Norris takes his first and McLaren's first podium since the 2022 Emilia Romagna GP.
2023-07-09T15:28:45Z: Verstappen wins the British GP! Norris takes second and Hamilton is third!
2023-07-09T15:27:25Z: Last lap time, so final orders at the bar please. Some podium bubbly for Verstappen, Norris and Hamilton?
2023-07-09T15:25:25Z: A five-second penalty for Stroll for his contact with Gasly. Already in P11, the overall impact is unlikely to make a difference to his season.
2023-07-09T15:25:24Z: Verstappen is eading to victory now, 3.5s up on Norris with two and a bit laps to go. Norris remains 1.7s ahead of Hamilton, while Piastri is 2.4s further back.
2023-07-09T15:24:38Z: Oh to be a fly on the wall in Ferrari motorhome this evening. after starting P4/5, to be now running P9/10 is a spectacular failure. Yes, the safety car did nothing to help their strategy, but everyone else also had that to navigate.
2023-07-09T15:23:14Z: Norris also gets a black and white flag so if he gets a penalty he'll currently drop from second to fourth.
2023-07-09T15:22:41Z: Russell is shown the black and white flag for track limits, so one more and he'll get a five-second penalty, which right now would drop him from fifth to seventh behind Perez and Alonso.
2023-07-09T15:22:15Z: Gasly returns to the pits and it's a double-DNF for Alpine.
2023-07-09T15:21:40Z: Replays of the Stroll-Gasly incident show that Stroll went off the track and made contact with the Alpine when he bounced back onto the track.I'd say that's a slam dunk penalty, but I thought that earlier about the earlier track limits overtaking issue!
2023-07-09T15:20:32Z: This clears this up a little. An incident involving Stroll and Gasly is being investigated by the stewards.
2023-07-09T15:19:48Z: Perez dives by Alonso into Stowe to move up to sixth place.
2023-07-09T15:19:26Z: Verstappen is matching the lap times of Norris and Hamilton behind him to maintain his 3.3s lead as we approach the closing stages.
2023-07-09T15:19:20Z: Gasly is off at Vale and has broken his rear suspension. It's difficult to know what happened there.
2023-07-09T15:18:35Z: Sainz drops to P11 behind Gasly but quickly regains the position into Copse with a bold move! He just cannot make the hard tyres work on his Ferrari.
2023-07-09T15:17:13Z: Norris has cleared out of DRS range of Hamilton as his hard tyres come into their own against the softs. Some excellent defending has paid off for the McLaren driver to push on in second place.
2023-07-09T15:16:21Z: Perez throws it down the inside of Sainz at Vale and Albon also takes advantage to gain a position! Leclerc climbs past as well! From P7 to P10 in a flash for Sainz.
2023-07-09T15:14:56Z: We were wrong about Stroll having to hand a position back. It seems that you are now permitted to go beyond the track limits and still gain a place. Given his time was deleted for track limits, we'll let you decide on that one!
2023-07-09T15:14:23Z: With 10 laps to go Verstappen opens up his lead to 3.2s over Norris with a new fastest lap of 1m30.275s.
2023-07-09T15:12:48Z: Those McLarens are rapid where it counts around Silverstone with some stellar defensive driving on show from both Norris and Piastri, against Hamilton and Russell respectively.
2023-07-09T15:12:08Z: Stroll has been noted for leaving the track and gaining an advantage. He ran over the white line when passing Gasly, and that is a position he will almost certainly be instructed to hand back.
2023-07-09T15:11:02Z: Norris drifts wide at Luffield to give Hamilton the inside line, but the McLaren driver keeps enough of his car ahead to grit it out on the outside to keep second place.
2023-07-09T15:10:42Z: DRS is enabled! Here we go!
2023-07-09T15:09:50Z: Albon holds off Leclerc on the first lap of the restarted race. The pair are hot on the heels of Sainz and Perez.
2023-07-09T15:09:06Z: Norris defends superbly to keep Hamilton behind him going around the National pits section, as Verstappen has bolted clear already with a 2s lead!
2023-07-09T15:07:45Z: Verstappen catches Norris napping and the McLaren driver is under pressure from Hamilton.
2023-07-09T15:07:20Z: GO GO GO! We return to racing conditions at Silverstone!
2023-07-09T15:06:27Z: Who is ready for a Silverstone sprint race to the finish?
2023-07-09T15:05:58Z: The safety car will return to the pits at the end of this lap!
2023-07-09T15:05:38Z: Just to recap the top 10 order and tyres under the safety car: Verstappen (softs), Norris (hards), Hamilton (softs), Piastri (hards), Russell (mediums), Alonso (softs), Sainz (hards), Perez (softs), Albon (softs) and Leclerc (mediums).
2023-07-09T15:04:41Z: The FIA has confirmed that the track is now clear. We'll likely have one more lap behind the safety car and will then continue on.
2023-07-09T15:03:29Z: Behind the safety car, Zhou has stopped again after complaining about a brake issue.
2023-07-09T15:02:14Z: The TV feed flicks to the McLaren garage to show Piastri's grandparents, and his grandmother looks spooked by it so grabs her husband's hand. Aww, bless them. Either that or they've just seen the Ashes test result.
2023-07-09T14:59:27Z: Magnussen's Haas has been moved to the side of the track but it is still smoking. This will take a few more laps to clear properly.
2023-07-09T14:59:08Z: Norris is on a set of fresh hard tyres, so in theory he has a big tyre deficit to Verstappen ahead of him and Hamilton behind him as they are both on softs.
2023-07-09T14:58:07Z: This intervention has been a disaster for Ferrari, with Sainz now P7 and Leclerc relegated to P10. For Williams and Albon, this has played out perfectly, pushing the Thai-British driver up into the points places.
2023-07-09T14:57:30Z: Hamilton is the biggest winner in all that, as he takes on fresh softs and comes out in third place ahead of Piastri and Russell.
2023-07-09T14:55:47Z: But the full safety car has now been deployed, as Verstappen, Norris, Hamilton and Alonso all get the chance for their cheap pitstop.
2023-07-09T14:54:24Z: This virtual safety car has given Albon and Leclerc a very cheap pitstop - but it was called just at the wrong time for Verstappen, Norris, Hamilton and Alonso who all missed the chance to pit.
2023-07-09T14:54:07Z: And now it's the full safety car after Magnussen stops on the Wellington Straight with his Haas on fire. It's safe to say the Ferrari power unit in his Haas has expired.
2023-07-09T14:52:28Z: A thrilling battle between Leclerc and Russell, as the latter goes around the outside of the Ferrari man at Luffield, and climbs to P8. Leclerc tries to come back but his much older hard tyres are no match for Russell's recently fitted rubber.
2023-07-09T14:51:39Z: At the front, it is easy going for Verstappen as his lead grows to nine seconds over Norris.
2023-07-09T14:51:22Z: On soft tyres, Perez is going for it and sets a new fastest lap of the race with a 1m31.408s.
2023-07-09T14:50:47Z: Here comes Carlos Sainz. He's rapidly catching Russell and Leclerc, and should clear Hamilton when the Mercedes driver pits.
2023-07-09T14:49:30Z: McLaren reacts and pits Piastri from third place. It is a smart stop of 2.4s and he rejoins in sixth place, comfortably ahead of Leclerc and Russell.
2023-07-09T14:48:18Z: Perez stops from P8. Medium tyres off but interestingly, the softs go on. This will provide those at the front with data on whether the soft compound is a viable option to take to the chequered flag.
2023-07-09T14:47:57Z: Russell duly pits for fresh mediums but it is a slow stop and he comes out in ninth and behind Leclerc.
2023-07-09T14:47:05Z: Russell is the tyre whisperer right now as his softs begin the 30th lap of their existence. It could give him a huge opportunity later in the race when he pits for fresh mediums.
2023-07-09T14:44:23Z: Sainz pits at the end of lap 26, locking up at pit entry a little, before swapping his mediums for fresh hards.
2023-07-09T14:43:15Z: After stopping for hard tyres, Leclerc is not showing anything like spectacular pace. He climbs past Stroll into P11, but his example will not tempt others into stopping anytime soon.
2023-07-09T14:42:46Z: Norris and McLaren are content with their current pace but they are losing half a second per lap to Verstappen now. But, in reality, their race isn't with the Red Bull driver, as they are keeping an eye on what's behind.
2023-07-09T14:39:46Z: News from Alpine, as it is confirmed that Ocon's car was retired with a hydraulic leak.
2023-07-09T14:39:11Z: Verstappen's unrelenting march at the front continues with another new fastest lap that grows his lead to 5.5s over Norris. Remember that time Norris was leading the British GP? Feels like a while ago now.
2023-07-09T14:38:24Z: As Gasly drops back from Alonso, he is falling back into the clutches of Perez. Red Bull could well be tempted to try the undercut here with the Mexican.
2023-07-09T14:37:23Z: There's some big and threatening clouds looming over the track but that promise of rain isn't coming yet.
2023-07-09T14:35:31Z: Verstappen is leaning on his tyres now, as he puts in a new fastest lap of 1m32.295s to push his lead to 4.6s on lap 21.
2023-07-09T14:33:46Z: Verstappen is 4.1s in the lead and clearly bored as he spots on the big screen Leclerc pitting. He's told not to worry about that.
2023-07-09T14:32:47Z: Gasly is now stuck behind Alonso with the Alpine driver swarming all over the Aston Martin's gearbox.
2023-07-09T14:32:05Z: Leclerc pits at the end of lap 19 to ditch his mediums for hards.
2023-07-09T14:31:43Z: Sainz didn't do his homework last night. He's asked to go for Plan B by Ferrari but admits he cannot remember what that is... oh dear.
2023-07-09T14:29:54Z: Into the points for Perez. He moves past Albon and into the points using DRS along the Hanger Straight.
2023-07-09T14:29:47Z: Lots of tyre management going on at the front, while Russell still cannot find a way past Leclerc in fourth place despite running half a second back.
2023-07-09T14:26:04Z: Medium tyres off and soft tyres on for Tsunoda.
2023-07-09T14:25:58Z: Verstappen has pushed out his lead to 3s over Norris, his last lap half a second quicker than the McLaren driver.
2023-07-09T14:25:39Z: Tsunoda is the first driver to make a planned pitstop from P13.
2023-07-09T14:23:46Z: Norris confirms over McLaren team radio he is going for Plan A, which is expected to be a one-stop race. So he'll be looking after his tyres to push out this stint.
2023-07-09T14:23:30Z: Stroll's afternoon and season takes another turn for the worse, as Perez gets past for P11. Just one more place for Perez before he hits the points-paying positions.
2023-07-09T14:22:31Z: Russell is reporting drops of rain on his visor... so, if his Spanish GP experience is to be followed, there's a 100% chance of sweat in that Mercedes cockpit.
2023-07-09T14:19:45Z: Rain is in the air... lots of teams are reporting it will hit the circuit in a couple of minutes. Spicy.
2023-07-09T14:18:17Z: The trio at the front have pulled a small gap of 3.6s on Leclerc in fourth, who still has Russell tucked up behind him.
2023-07-09T14:15:27Z: Hulkenberg has stopped for a new front wing after contact with Perez as the Red Bull driver continued his recovery. Perez is up to P13 and is chasing Ocon.
2023-07-09T14:14:22Z: But this time, Hamilton makes it stick! Down the Wellington Straight, he opened DRS and flew past Alonso. That was as easy as it comes. Hamilton has now disappeared into the distance and is hunting down Carlos Sainz.
2023-07-09T14:13:19Z: Norris is told Piastri has been ordered to hold position in third behind him, so that both McLaren cars can chase Verstappen and pull away from the rest.
2023-07-09T14:12:22Z: Hamilton is now all over the gearbox of Alonso for P7. He chases through Copse and will have DRS down the Hanger Straight.
2023-07-09T14:12:16Z: Russell looks for a way by Leclerc, but some robust defending from the Ferrari forces the Mercedes to yield at Stowe.
2023-07-09T14:11:07Z: That McLaren is slippery in a straight line, but there's nothing Norris can do to stop Verstappen with DRS, as he charges into the lead under braking at Brooklands on lap five.
2023-07-09T14:09:49Z: For those wondering about the weather, there is currently a 40% risk of rain for the race.
2023-07-09T14:09:29Z: Perez makes up one position to Williams driver Sargeant. Both drivers are on medium tyres.
2023-07-09T14:08:52Z: The problem for Norris is that Verstappen is coming. On lap four he is half a second back and in DRS range.
2023-07-09T14:08:15Z: Norris reacted 0.003s quicker to the lights than Verstappen according to the F1 data boffins. It made all the difference to give him the lead into the first corner.
2023-07-09T14:07:05Z: The gaps all the way through the field are tiny with few greater than a second. DRS is activated and now the real fun begins!
2023-07-09T14:06:54Z: Norris is trying to scamper clear of DRS range of Verstappen, which has been enabled at the end of lap two.
2023-07-09T14:06:12Z: Sergio Perez has also dropped a position at the start, down from P15 to P16. That was not in Red Bull's plan for a recovery drive from another shockingly bad Saturday for the Mexican.
2023-07-09T14:06:00Z: Further back Russell made the most of his soft tyres to get ahead of Sainz into fifth, while Hamilton had a poor start and dropped to eighth.
2023-07-09T14:05:26Z: Hamilton wastes no time in making back a position to Gasly, climbing back to P8 after a disappointing opening lap.
2023-07-09T14:05:16Z: Piastri is attacking Verstappen at Copse - flashbacks to 2021 - but the Australian keeps his nose clean and keeps station in third. A stunning opening lap by Norris who leads at the end of lap one!
2023-07-09T14:04:46Z: Stroll and Ocon are going wheel-to-wheel with Albon holding onto the final points-paying position so far.
2023-07-09T14:04:06Z: Hamilton is down to P9 after running wide into the complex on the first lap!
2023-07-09T14:03:57Z: Norris gets the better start and he leads Verstappen into Turn 1!
2023-07-09T14:02:30Z: Everyone is away smoothly, with plenty of heat being put into the tyres for those on mediums and hards. Verstappen has stretched out the F1 car train as a result on his way to the starting grid.
2023-07-09T14:00:29Z: The formation lap is under way.... here we go.
2023-07-09T13:59:57Z: So, watch out for Russell on softs being punchy at the start given everyone ahead of him starts on mediums.
2023-07-09T13:58:34Z: Starting tyres: Russell, Ocon, Tsunoda and de Vries all start on softs, Hulkenberg and Bottas are on hards and the rest are on mediums.
2023-07-09T13:50:51Z: Right, the pre-race faffing and fun is almost complete and the drivers are getting into their cars. Just 10 minutes to go until lights out.
2023-07-09T13:47:46Z: The British national anthem is given a, erm, unique rendition by Damian Lewis and a saxophone player. It was different but it worked.
2023-07-09T13:46:35Z: We had a few rain showers this morning but so far things have remained dry at Silverstone - but never fear, there is a 40% chance of rain for the race. It is the British GP after all.

2023-07-09T13:37:46Z: Back to the real F1 action, there's a good chance of a few strategy splits this afternoon to keep the action nicely spiced. But can anyone catch Verstappen? Given his current form it is a long shot, but you never know.
